metadata.title: Implement Show More/Less Text with Pure HTML and JavaScript
metadata.description: Learn how to create a 'show more/less' text toggle feature using only HTML and vanilla JavaScript, without external libraries or complex CSS.

prompts.PLACEHOLDER-1: A clean, modern decision tree flowchart. The start node is "Start". Branches lead to "Text content static or dynamic?". From "Static" and "Dynamic", branches lead to "Need to limit characters initially?". From "No" (both static/dynamic) lead to "Toggle `display` property". From "Yes" (both static/dynamic) lead to "Store full text, display truncated, toggle content". Finally, "Toggle `display` property" leads to "Simple Visibility Toggle" and "Store full text, display truncated, toggle content" leads to "Content Replacement Toggle". Both final nodes lead to "End". Use a light color scheme with clear, distinct boxes and arrows.
prompts.PLACEHOLDER-2: A visual workflow diagram showing the steps for "Toggle Display Property". Start with a box labeled "Page Load: Content Hidden (display: none)". An arrow points to a button labeled "Show More" being clicked. This leads to a box "JavaScript: Checks `display` is 'none'". An arrow then points to "JavaScript: Sets `display` to 'block'". Another arrow points to "JavaScript: Updates button text to 'Show Less'". This leads to a box "Content Visible, Button 'Show Less'". An arrow from this box points back to the button, now labeled "Show Less" being clicked, leading to "JavaScript: Checks `display` is 'block'". This then loops back to "JavaScript: Sets `display` to 'none'". Use simple icons for HTML elements and JavaScript code.
prompts.PLACEHOLDER-3: A visual workflow diagram showing the steps for "Content Truncation and Replacement". Start with a box labeled "Page Load: Full Text in `data-fulltext`". An arrow points to "JavaScript: Truncates text, displays '...'". An arrow points to a button labeled "Show More" being clicked. This leads to a box "JavaScript: Checks if current text is truncated". An arrow then points to "JavaScript: Replaces with full text from `data-fulltext`". Another arrow points to "JavaScript: Updates button text to 'Show Less'". This leads to a box "Full Content Visible, Button 'Show Less'". An arrow from this box points back to the button, now labeled "Show Less" being clicked, leading to "JavaScript: Checks if current text is full". This then loops back to "JavaScript: Truncates text, displays '...'". Use simple icons for HTML elements and JavaScript code.
